results.title: The Prospector
results.creator_credit: Daryl Hill and Children's Library and Crafts Movement Australiaz
results.brief_description: A man who has been “panning” for gold all his life in the vicinity of the Hill End goldfields gives an account of how the fossicking is actually done, and gives something of the history of Hill End itself.

results.title: Promotion by-pass
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
The office manager has been called on to make a recommendation for promotion and decides on a younger employee because of his ability to get on with people. The older man who has been with the company for fifteen years is passed over. He is disgruntled and resigns although the supervisor tries to explain the situation to him. Discussion is on the question of whether the office manager was right to make the decision that he did.

results.title: Projective generation of conics (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Allen Downs, Bob Nelson and College Geometry Project, University of Minnesota
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Introduces the eccentricity definition, then focuses on projective definitions devoid of metric notion implying the construction of a conic by straight edge alone. Shows methods of construction developed by Pascal, Malaurin, Braikenridge, Poncelet and Steiner. The logical relationship between the methods is demonstrated.

results.title: Progressive waves: transverse & longitudinal
results.brief_description: Introduces the subject of transverse progressive waves by Illustrating a pulse being sent down a stretched rope. Shows its velocity of travel to be dependent upon the elastic and inertial factors. Employs a stretched string to show steady waves train propagation, and identifies and relates waves length and frequency. Longitudinal wave disturbance is shown by a pulse moving down a row of beads connected by light-weight strings.

results.title: Professor Erikson. Part 2
results.creator_credit: James L. Brown and KUHT Film Productions
results.brief_description: An investigation of some theories of psychoanalysis, and personality growth in relation to the work of Dr Erik Erikson, of Harvard University, a pioneer in the field of child analysis and research. Part 2 deals with the Libido theory, Ego-identity, Identity crisis, Positive and negative identity, existentialism, cross-cultural research, fixation and the value of psycho-therapy. The ensuing discussion touches upon Erikson’s relationship to the theories of Freud; additions and modifications to subsequent theories; the crisis of adolescence; and the problems facing psycho-analysis today.

results.title: Professor Erikson. Part 1
results.creator_credit: James L. Brown and KUHT Film Productions
results.brief_description: An investigation of some theories of psychoanalysis, and personality growth. The film takes the form of an interview between Dr Erik Erikson, of Harvard University, a pioneer in the field of child analysis and research and Dr Richard Evans, of the University of Houston. They discuss Erikson’s theory of the eight stages of psycho development. Part 1 and 2 produced under a grant awarded by the national Science Foundation, USA.

results.title: Professional Icing at Home
results.brief_description: Jean Bowring demonstrates how to decorate a birthday cake using simple equipment and techniques. A fruit cake is first covered with fondant icing and then decorated using an icing bag and assortment of tubes. The film concludes with examples of more elaborate work in which the same simple techniques of decoration have been used.

results.title: Product development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The film considered the following: (1) The role of research in improving materials processes and product; (2) the qualifications for acceptable product ideas such as production requirements in relation to existing facilities; (3) and aspects of product engineering.
